00123 #define CTRL_Q                0x11

00127 #define QUIT_APPEND           CTRL_Q

00144 static void at45dbx_resources_init(void)
00145 {
00146   static const gpio_map_t AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP =
00147   {
00148     {AT45DBX_SPI_SCK_PIN,          AT45DBX_SPI_SCK_FUNCTION         },  // SPI Clock.
00149     {AT45DBX_SPI_MISO_PIN,         AT45DBX_SPI_MISO_FUNCTION        },  // MISO.
00150     {AT45DBX_SPI_MOSI_PIN,         AT45DBX_SPI_MOSI_FUNCTION        },  // MOSI.
00151 #define AT45DBX_ENABLE_NPCS_PIN(NPCS, unused) \
00152     {AT45DBX_SPI_NPCS##NPCS##_PIN, AT45DBX_SPI_NPCS##NPCS##_FUNCTION},  // Chip Select NPCS.
00153     MREPEAT(AT45DBX_MEM_CNT, AT45DBX_ENABLE_NPCS_PIN, ~)
00154 #undef AT45DBX_ENABLE_NPCS_PIN
00155   };
00156 
00157   // SPI options.
00158   spi_options_t spiOptions =
00159   {
00160     .reg          = 0,
00161     .baudrate     = AT45DBX_SPI_MASTER_SPEED, // Defined in conf_at45dbx.h.
00162     .bits         = AT45DBX_SPI_BITS,         // Defined in conf_at45dbx.h.
00163     .spck_delay   = 0,
00164     .trans_delay  = 0,
00165     .stay_act     = 1,
00166     .spi_mode     = 0,
00167     .fdiv         = 0,
00168     .modfdis      = 1
00169   };
00170 
00171   // Assign I/Os to SPI.
00172   gpio_enable_module(AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP,
00173                      sizeof(AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(AT45DBX_SPI_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00174 
00175   // Initialize as master.
00176   spi_initMaster(AT45DBX_SPI, &spiOptions);
00177 
00178   // Set selection mode: variable_ps, pcs_decode, delay.
00179   spi_selectionMode(AT45DBX_SPI, 0, 0, 0);
00180 
00181   // Enable SPI.
00182   spi_enable(AT45DBX_SPI);
00183 
00184   // Initialize data flash with SPI clock Osc0.
00185   at45dbx_init(spiOptions, FOSC0);
00186 }

00200 int main(void)
00201 {
00202 char filename1[90];
00203 char filename2[90];
00204 
00205   // switch to external oscillator 0
00206   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00207 
00208   // initialize RS232 debug text output
00209   init_dbg_rs232(FOSC0);
00210 
00211   // initialize AT45DBX resources: GPIO, SPI and AT45DBX
00212   at45dbx_resources_init();
00213 
00214   // initialize FSACCESS mutex and navigators
00215   b_fsaccess_init();
00216 
00217   // Try to init data flash
00218   if (at45dbx_mem_check())
00219   {
00220     // display welcome message
00221     print_dbg(MSG_WELCOME);
00222   }
00223   else
00224   {
00225     // display error message
00226     print_dbg("Initialization failed\r\n");
00227     return (-1);
00228   }
00229 
00230   while (TRUE)
00231   {
00232     // check the user command
00233     switch (fsaccess_example_get_mode())
00234     {
00235     case '1':
00236       // Wait for a filename
00237       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename1);
00238       // Read it and display the content
00239       fsaccess_example_read(filename1);
00240     break;
00241     case '2':
00242       // Wait for source filename
00243       print_dbg("Source : ");
00244       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename1);
00245       // Wait for destination filename
00246       print_dbg("Destination : ");
00247       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename2);
00248       // Write from source to destination (append to the existing file)
00249       fsaccess_example_write(filename1, filename2, O_APPEND);
00250     break;
00251     case '3':
00252       // Wait for source filename
00253       print_dbg("Source : ");
00254       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename1);
00255       // Wait for destination filename
00256       print_dbg("Destination : ");
00257       fsaccess_example_get_filename(filename2);
00258       // Write from source to destination (append to the unexisting file)
00259       fsaccess_example_write(filename1, filename2, (O_CREAT | O_APPEND));
00260     break;
00261     default:
00262       // Display error message
00263       print_dbg("Wrong choice\r\n");
00264     break;
00265     }
00266   }
00267 }
00268 
00271 int fsaccess_example_get_mode (void)
00272 {
00273 int c;
00274 
00275   // Display asking message
00276   print_dbg(MSG_MODE);
00277   while (TRUE)
00278   {
00279     // If something new in the USART :
00280     if (usart_read_char(DBG_USART, &c) == USART_SUCCESS)
00281     {
00282       // Echo char
00283       print_dbg_char(c);
00284       // Add LF
00285       print_dbg_char(LF);
00286       return (c);
00287     }
00288   }
00289 }
00290 
00293 void fsaccess_example_get_filename (char * buf)
00294 {
00295 unsigned long i_str = 0;
00296 unsigned short file;
00297 int c;
00298 
00299   // Display asking message
00300   print_dbg(MSG_FILENAME);
00301   file = FALSE;
00302 
00303   while (file == FALSE)
00304   {
00305     // If something new in the USART :
00306     if (usart_read_char(DBG_USART, &c) == USART_SUCCESS)
00307     {
00308       // Regarding the received char :
00309       switch (c)
00310       {
00311       // This is a carriage return
00312       case CR:
00313         // Add LF
00314         print_dbg_char(LF);
00315         // Add NUL char
00316         buf[i_str] = '\0';
00317         // End the loop
00318         file = TRUE;
00319         // Reset string length
00320         i_str = 0;
00321       break;
00322       // This is a CTRL+C
00323       case ABORT_CHAR:
00324         i_str = 0;
00325         print_dbg_char(LF);       // Add LF
00326         print_dbg(MSG_FILENAME);
00327       break;
00328       // This is a backspace
00329       case BKSPACE_CHAR:
00330         if (i_str > 0)
00331         {
00332           // Echo the backspace
00333           print_dbg_char(c);
00334           // Echo a space
00335           print_dbg_char(' ');
00336           // Echo the backspace
00337           print_dbg_char(c);
00338           // Decrease string length
00339           i_str--;
00340         }
00341       break;
00342       // This is a char
00343       default:
00344         // Echo it
00345         print_dbg_char(c);
00346         // Append to cmd line and increase string length
00347         buf[i_str++] = c;
00348       break;
00349       }
00350     }
00351   }
00352 }
00353 
00356 int fsaccess_example_read(char * path)
00357 {
00358 char * ptrFile;
00359 int fd, i;
00360 long size;
00361 
00362   // Try to open the file
00363   if ((fd = open(path, O_RDONLY)) < 0)
00364   {
00365     // Display error message
00366     print_dbg(path);
00367     print_dbg(" : Open failed\n");
00368     return (-1);
00369   }
00370 
00371   // Get file size
00372   size = fsaccess_file_get_size(fd);
00373   // Display file size
00374   print_dbg("File size: ");
00375   print_dbg_ulong(size);
00376   print_dbg_char(LF);
00377 
00378   // Allocate a buffer
00379   ptrFile = malloc((NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) + 1);
00380 
00381   // Allocation fails
00382   if (ptrFile == NULL)
00383   {
00384     // Display error message
00385     print_dbg("Malloc failed\n");
00386   }
00387   else
00388   {
00389     // Try to perform a single access
00390     if ( size < (NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) )
00391     {
00392       if( read(fd, ptrFile, size) != size)
00393       {
00394          // Display error message
00395          print_dbg("Reading entire file failed\n");
00396       }
00397        else
00398        {
00399          // Add a null terminating char
00400          ptrFile[size] = '\0';
00401          // Display the buffer to user
00402          print_dbg(ptrFile);
00403        }
00404     }
00405     else
00406     {
00407       // Try to send the biggest frame contained in the file
00408       for (i = NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND ; i > 0 ; i--)
00409       {
00410         // Get sectors of maximum size
00411         while(size > i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)
00412         {
00413           // Get the data from file
00414           if( read(fd, ptrFile, i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) !=  i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)
00415           {
00416             // Display error message
00417             print_dbg("Reading file block failed\n");
00418             // Close file
00419             close(fd);
00420             return (-1);
00421           }
00422           // Add a null terminating character
00423           ptrFile[i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR] = '\0';
00424           // Display buffer content to user
00425           print_dbg(ptrFile);
00426           // Decrease remaining size
00427           size -= (i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR);
00428         }
00429       }
00430       // Finish with the few data remaining (less than 1 sector)
00431       if ( size > 0 )
00432       {
00433         // Get the data from filesystem
00434         if( read(fd, ptrFile, size) != size)
00435         {
00436           // Display error message
00437           print_dbg("Reading file end failed\n");
00438           // Close file
00439           close(fd);
00440           return (-1);
00441         }
00442         else
00443         {
00444           // Add a null terminating char
00445           ptrFile[size] = '\0';
00446           // Display the buffer to user
00447           print_dbg(ptrFile);
00448         }
00449       }
00450     }
00451     // Free the buffer
00452     free(ptrFile);
00453   }
00454   // Close file
00455   close(fd);
00456   return (0);
00457 }
00458 
00461 int fsaccess_example_write(char * source, char * destination, int flags)
00462 {
00463 char * ptrFile;
00464 int fd1, fd2, i;
00465 long size;
00466 int ErrorCode = -1;
00467 
00468   if ((fd1 = open(source, O_RDONLY)) < 0)
00469   {
00470     // Display error message
00471     print_dbg(source);
00472     print_dbg(": Open failed\n");
00473     return (ErrorCode);
00474   }
00475   if ((fd2 = open(destination, flags)) < 0)
00476   {
00477     // Display error message
00478     print_dbg(destination);
00479     print_dbg(": Open failed\n");
00480     return (ErrorCode);
00481   }
00482 
00483   // Get file size
00484   size = fsaccess_file_get_size(fd1);
00485   // Display file size
00486   print_dbg("Copying ");
00487   print_dbg_ulong(size);
00488   print_dbg(" Bytes\n");
00489 
00490   // Allocate a buffer
00491   ptrFile = malloc(NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR);
00492 
00493   // Allocation fails
00494   if (ptrFile == NULL)
00495   {
00496     // Display error message
00497     print_dbg("Malloc failed\n");
00498     return (ErrorCode);
00499   }
00500   else
00501   {
00502     if ( size <= (NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) )
00503     {
00504       if ( read(fd1, ptrFile, size) != size )
00505       {
00506         // Display error message
00507         print_dbg("Reading entire file failed\n");
00508         // Escape
00509         goto close_end;
00510       }
00511       if ( write(fd2, ptrFile, size) != size )
00512       {
00513         // Display error message
00514         print_dbg("Writing entire file failed\n");
00515         // Escape
00516         goto close_end;
00517       }
00518     }
00519     else
00520     {
00521       // Try to send the biggest frame contained in the file
00522       for (i = NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND ; i > 0 ; i--)
00523       {
00524         // Get sectors of maximum size
00525         while(size > i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)
00526         {
00527           // Clear previous buffer
00528           memset(ptrFile, 0, NB_SECTOR_TO_SEND * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR);
00529           // Read the data from source file
00530           if( read(fd1, ptrFile, i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) !=  i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR)
00531           {
00532             print_dbg("Reading file block failed\n");
00533             // Escape
00534             goto close_end;
00535           }
00536           // Write the data to destination file
00537           if ( write(fd2, ptrFile, i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR) != i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR )
00538           {
00539             print_dbg("Writing file block failed\n");
00540             // Escape
00541             goto close_end;
00542           }
00543           // Decrease remaining size
00544           size -= (i * FS_SIZE_OF_SECTOR);
00545         }
00546       }
00547       // Finish with the few data remaining (less than 1 sector)
00548       if ( size > 0 )
00549       {
00550         // Get the data from filesystem
00551         if( read(fd1, ptrFile, size) !=  size)
00552         {
00553           print_dbg("Reading file end failed\n");
00554           // Escape
00555           goto close_end;
00556         }
00557         if ( write(fd2, ptrFile, size) != size )
00558         {
00559           print_dbg("Writing file end failed\n");
00560           // Escape
00561           goto close_end;
00562         }
00563       }
00564     }
00565     // No error occurs here
00566     ErrorCode = 0;
00567   }
00568 
00569 close_end:
00570   // Free the buffer
00571   free(ptrFile);
00572   // Close files
00573   close(fd1);
00574   close(fd2);
00575   return (ErrorCode);
00576 }
